results:
Based on the search results, I found detailed information about the Polish translation of Emily Brontë's "Wuthering Heights" by Janina Sujkowska in 1929.

Here's what the search revealed:

In Poland, the novel was first published in 1929 under the title "Szatańska miłość" (Satanic Love) in the translation by Janina Sujkowska. This information is consistently confirmed across multiple sources.

The first edition appeared in 1929 under the title "Szatańska miłość," and only later, post-war editions carried the title "Wichrowe Wzgórza."(no content)In Poland, Emily Brontë's novel was first published in 1929 under the title "Szatańska miłość" in Janina Sujkowska's translation. Later, post-war editions of the book with the new title "Wichrowe Wzgórza" were also in Sujkowska's translation.

Several sources mention the significance of this original Polish title. What most intrigued reviewers was the presentation of "Wichrowe Wzgórza" and its characters in a metaphysical sense - not without reason the first edition of the novel bore the title "Szatańska miłość."(no content)Not without reason, the title of the first Polish edition of Emily Brontë's only novel was "Szatańska miłość."

The search results show that Janina Sujkowska's translation became the standard Polish version for many decades, with Polish readers knowing "Wichrowe wzgórza" from Janina Sujkowska's translation until more recent retranslations appeared.

This 1929 translation appears to be historically significant as the first Polish rendering of Emily Brontë's classic novel, introducing Polish readers to this important work of English literature under the evocative title "Szatańska miłość."
